content: On September 17, 1982, the Atlanta Braves clinched the National League West title, marking their first division championship since moving to Atlanta in 1966. The Braves secured the title with a 7-1 victory over the San Diego Padres at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium, highlighted by a strong performance from pitcher Phil Niekro, who threw a complete game. This moment was significant as it set the stage for the Braves' return to postseason play, ultimately leading them to the World Series that year.
